intro: Amphoricarpos neumayerianus subsp. murbeckii, commonly known as the Neumayer's sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and succulent leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This subspecies is often found in rocky or sandy habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native environment.
